body:
`{{block "" .}}` is just wrong, so the code should fail somehow but I'm not sure exactly how or when. It's possible that this stack overflow is an acceptable failure mode.

A blockÂ defines a template, so we could make it so that it is not possible for a block to re-define the template in which the block appears. But even if that were done, it would still be possible to construct a cycle of nested templates if you try hard enough.
